question.title: Find min items in each group of array
question.body:
Give an array of numbers of size n, pick a group of size m, find the kth minimum element in that group.

Example:

arr = [1, 3, 2, 1], m = 3, k = 2
m represents a group size
k represents the kth minimum element in the group of size m
so find the 2nd minimum element in a group of size 3.

There are 2 contiguous groups possible:
[1, 3, 2] and [3, 2, 1]

k = 2 , 2nd minimum element in above groups is [2,2]

Constraints:

k, m , n are of size 1 to 10^5
array item is of size 1 to 10^9

Here is my code:

Approach 1: This is my naive approach:

public static int[] solve(int[] arr, int m, int k) {
    List<Integer> result = new ArrayList<>();
    int n = arr.length;
    for(int i=0; i<=n-m; i++) {
       int[] sub = Arrays.copyOfRange(arr, i, i+m);
       Arrays.sort(sub);
       result.add(sub[k-1]);
    }
    return result;
}

This approach is not time efficient so fails for large inputs

Approach 2: Using Queue:

public static int[] solve(int[] arr, int m, int k) {
    int n = arr.length;
    int[] result = new int[n - m + 1];
    Queue<Integer> q = new PriorityQueue<>((a, b) -> Integer.compare(b, a));

    for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
        q.add(arr[i]);
        if (q.size() > k) {
            q.poll();
        }
    }
    result[0] = q.peek();

    for (int i = 1; i <= n - m; i++) {
        int left = arr[i - 1];
        if (q.contains(left)) {
            q.remove(left);
        } else {
            q.poll();
        }
        q.add(arr[i+m-1]);
        result[i] = q.peek();
    }

    return result;
}

My 2nd approach fails with wrong output when input array size is more. What is the correct approach to solve this?
